result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig A Jerome was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Craig A Jerome, appeared. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 07:45 am.
Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - conviction DNA on file

Defendant Craig A Jerome in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1&2. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld on both counts, 2 yr. probation, conditions: $443 & $243 costs, review in six months, Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not possess drug paraphernalia.Submit DNA sample. Ct. 3 dismissed. Court granted 3 days jail credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 23, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant, Craig A Jerome, appeared In custody with Attorney Leonie Dolch from the public defenders office. Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reading waived. State requested low cash bond. Atty. Dolch argued for recog. bond. $1,500 recog. bond with not consume/possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without valid Rx.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
